RookieUpdated on 07 Jun 2019Do be mindful of 'Dishonest misappropriation of property'!403.  Whoever dishonestly misappropriates or converts to his own use movable property, shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to 2 years, or with fine, or with both.Days of finders keepers are long gone with CCTV all around us. As I always say to my younger cousins, it's not worth it!Though how you found it does play a part, ie:(a)  A finds a dollar on the high road, not knowing to whom the dollar belongs. A picks up the dollar. Here A has not committed the offence defined in this section.(e)  A finds a purse with money, not knowing to whom it belongs; he afterwards discovers that it belongs to Z, and appropriates it to his own use. A is guilty of an offence under this section.https://sso.agc.gov.sg/Act/PC1871?ProvIds=pr403-&ViewType=Advance&Phrase=theft&WiAl=11 comment3
